author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of members of the Southern Railway Mazdoor Union (SRMU), including women, staged a dharna in front of the Salem Railway Divisional office on Thursday demanding the removal of anomalies in the Seventh Pay Commission recommendations and also to press their charter of demands.

They demanded the Railways to fix a minimum salary of Rs. 26,000 to the employees, do away with the new pension scheme, and remove the ceiling for sanctioning bonus. The dharna was also to oppose privatisation move.

M. Govindan, divisional secretary, SRMU, led the agitation. M. Pandian, divisional president of SRMU, and Sundaravadivel, divisional vice-president, spoke highlighting the demands. The call for the agitation was given by the National Joint Council of Action of Railway Unions.
title: SRMU members stage dharna
